text: sheldon_cooper Checkmate .

sheldon_cooper Obviously you 're not well suited for three - dimensional chess , perhaps three dimensional candyland would be more your speed .

sheldon_cooper It must be humbling to suck on so many different levels .
penny Hi guys .
leonard_hofstadter Hey !
penny Did you get my mail .
leonard_hofstadter Yeah , right here . How was Nebraska ?
penny Oh , better than North Dakota ! I guess that joke 's only funny in Nebraska .
sheldon_cooper From the data at hand you really ca n't draw that conclusion . All you can say with absolute certainty is that that joke is not funny here .
penny Boy , it 's good to be back .
leonard_hofstadter How was your family ?
penny Ugh , it was the worst trip , everyone got sick over the weekend .
sheldon_cooper Sick ?
leonard_hofstadter Here we go .
sheldon_cooper What kind of sick ?
penny Oh , the flu I guess .
sheldon_cooper I do n't need you to guess , I need you to know , now when did the symptoms first appear ?
penny Maybe Friday .
sheldon_cooper Friday , was that morning or afternoon ?
penny I ... . I do n't ... .
sheldon_cooper Think woman , who blew their nose and when ?
leonard_hofstadter Sheldon , relax , she does n't have any symptoms , I 'm sure she 's not contagious .

sheldon_cooper Oh please , if influenza was only contagious after symptoms appear it would have died out thousands of years ago . Somewhere between tool using and cave painting , homo habilus would have figured out to kill the guy with the runny nose .
leonard_hofstadter Penny , you 'll have to excuse Sheldon , he 's a bit of a germophobe .
penny Oh , it 's okay , I understand .
sheldon_cooper Thanks for your consideration , now please leave .
leonard_hofstadter You 'd better go before he starts spraying you with Lysol .
penny Okay , well , thank you for getting my mail .
leonard_hofstadter No problem . Welcome home .
sheldon_cooper What ?
leonard_hofstadter What the hell are you doing ?
sheldon_cooper I 'm making petrie dishes to grow throat cultures .
leonard_hofstadter With lime jello ?
sheldon_cooper I need a growth medium , and someone polished off the apricot yoghurt . Here , swab my throat .
leonard_hofstadter I do n't think so .
sheldon_cooper Leonard ! If I 'm going to get ahead of this thing I need to find out what 's growing in my throat .
leonard_hofstadter Sheldon , you are not sick . This is , but you are not .
sheldon_cooper We have no idea what pathogen Typhoid Penny has introduced into our environment . And having never been to Nebraska I 'm fairly certain that I have no cornhusking antibodies .
leonard_hofstadter Sheldon , do n't you think you 're overreacting ?
sheldon_cooper When I 'm lying comatose in a hospital relying on inferior minds to cure me , these jello cultures and my accompanying notes will give them a fighting chance .
leonard_hofstadter I 'm going back to bed .
sheldon_cooper Wait . Put this in the bathroom .
leonard_hofstadter What for ?
sheldon_cooper I need to measure my fluid intake and output to make sure my kidneys are n't shutting down .
leonard_hofstadter I mix pancake batter in this !
sheldon_cooper No , that measuring cup has always been for urine .
leonard_hofstadter You had time to make a label for everything in this apartment , including the label maker , but you did n't have ten seconds to make one that said urine cup ?
sheldon_cooper It 's right here on the bottom .
leonard_hofstadter Huh . I guess I owe the Betty Crocker company a letter of apology .
sheldon_cooper Oh , dear God . Leonard ! Leonard , I 'm sick !
sheldon_cooper Leonard ! Leonard I 'm sick !
sheldon_cooper Leonard ! Leonard ! Leonard . Leonard , my comforter fell down , and my sinuses hurt when I bend over . Leonard ? Ow !
leonard_hofstadter Hey .
sheldon_cooper Leonard , where are you ?
leonard_hofstadter I 'm at work .
sheldon_cooper At six - thirty in the morning ?
leonard_hofstadter Yes .
sheldon_cooper On Sunday ?
leonard_hofstadter Yes .
sheldon_cooper Why ?
leonard_hofstadter They asked me to come in .
sheldon_cooper Well , I did n't hear the phone ring .
leonard_hofstadter They texted me .
sheldon_cooper Well , as I predicted , I am sick . My fever has been tracking up exponentially since 2 am , and I am producing sputum at an alarming rate .
leonard_hofstadter No kidding ?
sheldon_cooper No . Not only that , it has shifted from clear to milky green .
leonard_hofstadter Alright , well , get some rest and drink plenty of fluids .
sheldon_cooper What else would I drink ? Gasses ? Solids ? Ionised plasma ?
leonard_hofstadter Drink whatever you want .
sheldon_cooper I want soup .
leonard_hofstadter Then make soup .
sheldon_cooper We do n't have soup .
leonard_hofstadter I 'm at work , Sheldon .
sheldon_cooper Is that a dog ?
leonard_hofstadter Yes , .
sheldon_cooper In the lab ?
leonard_hofstadter Yes , they 're training dogs to operate the centrifuge for when they need dogs to operate the centrifuge for blind scientists , I have to go .
debbie_wolowitz Howard , it 's the phone .
howard_wolowitz I know it 's the phone , Ma , I hear the phone .
debbie_wolowitz Well who 's calling at this ungodly hour ?
howard_wolowitz I do n't know .
debbie_wolowitz Well ask them why they 're calling at this ungodly hour .
howard_wolowitz How can I ask them when I 'm talking to you ! Hello .
leonard_hofstadter Howard , it 's Leonard , code Milky Green .
howard_wolowitz Dear Lord , not Milky Green !
leonard_hofstadter Affirmative , with fever .
debbie_wolowitz Who 's on the phone .
howard_wolowitz It 's Leonard .
debbie_wolowitz Why is he calling .
howard_wolowitz Sheldon 's sick .
debbie_wolowitz Were you playing with him ?
howard_wolowitz For God 's sake , Ma , I 'm twenty six years old .
debbie_wolowitz Excuse me Mr Grown - up . Whadda - ya want for breakfast .
howard_wolowitz Chocolate milk and eggoes please !
leonard_hofstadter Howard , listen to me .
howard_wolowitz Hang on , call waiting .
leonard_hofstadter No , do n't , do n't ... .
howard_wolowitz Hello .
sheldon_cooper Howard , I 'm sick .
howard_wolowitz Howard 's sleeping , this is his mother . Why are you calling at this ungodly hour ?
sheldon_cooper I need soup .
howard_wolowitz Then call your own mother . It was Sheldon .
leonard_hofstadter I tried to stop you .
howard_wolowitz It 's my own fault , I forgot the protocol we put in place after the great ear infection of ' 06 .
leonard_hofstadter You call Koothrappali , we need to find a place to lay low for the next eighteen to twenty four hours .
howard_wolowitz Stand by . Ma , can my friends come over ?
debbie_wolowitz I just had the carpets steamed .
howard_wolowitz That 's a negatory . But there 's a Planet of the Apes marathon at the New Art today .
leonard_hofstadter Five movies , two hours apiece . It 's a start .
waitress Homeless crazy guy at table eighteen .
penny No , just crazy . Sheldon , what are you doing here ?
sheldon_cooper I 'm sick , thank you very much .
penny How could you have gotten it from me , I 'm not sick .
sheldon_cooper You 're a carrier . All these people here are doomed . You 're doomed !
penny Shhh ! Sheldon , what do you want .
sheldon_cooper I want soup .
penny Why did n't you just ... Why did n't you just have soup at home .
sheldon_cooper Penny , I have an IQ of 187 , do n't you imagine that if there were a way for me to have had soup at home I would have thought of it ?
penny You can have soup delivered .
sheldon_cooper I did not think of that . Clearly febrile delirium is setting in , please bring me some soup while I still understand what a spoon is for .
penny Okay , what kind of soup do you want .
sheldon_cooper Well , my mother used to make me this split pea with little frankfurter slices and these home made croutons .
penny We have Chicken Tortilla and Potato Leek .
sheldon_cooper Can I get any of those with little frankfurter slices and home made croutons ?
penny No .
sheldon_cooper Then surprise me . Would you call that moss green or forest green ?
howard_wolowitz Look at this , everyone went chimp .
raj_koothrappali Well I 'd like to point out , I voted for orang - utan , but you shouted me down . .
leonard_hofstadter Oh , hi Penny !
penny Hey , where are you ?
leonard_hofstadter I 'm ... uh ... at work .
penny You sound funny .
leonard_hofstadter I 'm ... uh ... in a ... I 'm in a radiation suit . What 's up ?
penny Yeah , well I 'm at work too , and you 'll never guess who 's here infecting my entire station .
leonard_hofstadter Sheldon 's at the Cheesecake Factory . Just tell him to go home .
penny He wo n't leave , he says he 's afraid he 'll pass out on the bus and someone will harvest his organs .
leonard_hofstadter He 's paranoid , and he 's established a nest .
penny Can you please come get him ?

leonard_hofstadter Uh , yeah , I 'd be ... I 'd be happy to Penny . Oh my God there 's a breech in the radiation unit The whole city is in jeopardy , oh my God , Professor Googenfeil is melting , got ta go , bye ! I feel really guilty .
raj_koothrappali You did what you had to do .
howard_wolowitz Take your stinking paws off my popcorn you damn dirty ape .
sheldon_cooper Thanks for bringing me home .
penny Oh , it 's okay , I did n't really need to work today , it 's not like I have rent or car payments or anything .
sheldon_cooper Good . Good .
penny Okay , well , you feel better .
sheldon_cooper Wait , where are you going ?
penny Um , home , to write some bad checks .
sheldon_cooper You 're going to leave me ?
penny Sheldon , you are a grown man , have n't you ever been sick before ?
sheldon_cooper Well , of course , but , not by myself .
penny Really , never ?
sheldon_cooper Well , once . When I was fifteen , and spending the summer at the Heidelberg Institute in Germany .
penny Studying abroad ?

sheldon_cooper No , visiting professor . Anyway , the local cuisine was a little more sausage - based than I 'm used to , and the result was an internal blitzkrieg with my lower intestine playing the part of Czechoslovakia .
penny And there was no - one there to take care of you ?
sheldon_cooper No . No , my mom had to fly back to Texas to help my dad because the house had slipped off the cinderblocks again .
penny Again ?

sheldon_cooper It was tornado season . And it was an aluminum house . Anyway , the housekeeper in the faculty residence did n't speak any English , when I finally managed to convince her I was sick , she said ' Möchtest Du eine Darmspülung ? '
penny What does that mean ?
sheldon_cooper Based on what happened next , I assume it means ' would you like an enema ? '
penny Okay , sweetie , I 'll take care of you , what do you need ?
sheldon_cooper Well , my mom used to give me sponge baths .
penny Okay , ground rules , no sponge baths , and definitely no enemas .
sheldon_cooper Agreed .
raj_koothrappali Here we go , ten and a half hours of apey goodness .
leonard_hofstadter Oh dammit , my glasses . Okay , I 'm blind here guys , can you help me find them ?
howard_wolowitz Sorry . Found 'em .
leonard_hofstadter Oh great .
howard_wolowitz Sorry , do n't you have a spare .
leonard_hofstadter Yeah , at home .
raj_koothrappali Well if you leave now , you can be back before the gorillas rip the crap out of Charlton Heston .
howard_wolowitz Unless Sheldon 's there , in which case you 'll be trapped forever in his whiny hyper neurotic snot - web .

leonard_hofstadter Hi , Penny . I was wondering , is Sheldon still at the restaurant ? Okay , that was very nice of you . Okay , got ta go , got kind of a full blown Chernobyl thing here , got ta go , bye . He 's home , I 'm screwed . Ten and a half hours of apey blurriness .
raj_koothrappali How about Lasic ?
leonard_hofstadter You want me to get eye surgery ?
raj_koothrappali Would you rather go back to the apartment and deal with Sheldon , or have a stranger carve out your corneas with a laser beam ?
howard_wolowitz Well ?
leonard_hofstadter I 'm thinking !
penny Okay , nice and cosy , okay , I 'll see you later .
sheldon_cooper Wait . Will you please rub this on my chest .
penny Oh , Sheldon , ca n't you do that yourself ?
sheldon_cooper Vaporub makes my hands smell funny .
penny But Sheldon ... .
sheldon_cooper Please , please , please , please , please , please , please .
penny I ca n't believe I 'm doing this .
sheldon_cooper No , no , counter - clockwise or my chest hair mats .
penny Sorry .
sheldon_cooper Can you sing ' Soft Kitty ' .
penny What ?
sheldon_cooper My mom used to sing it to me when I was sick .
penny I 'm sorry , honey , I do n't know it .
sheldon_cooper I 'll teach you . ' Soft kitty , warm kitty , little ball of fur , happy kitty , sleepy kitty , purr purr purr . ' Now you .
penny Soft kitty , warm kitty ... .
sheldon_cooper Little ball of fur . Keep rubbing .
penny Little ball of fur .
leonard_hofstadter What do you see , what do you see .
raj_koothrappali The living room appears to be empty .
leonard_hofstadter Okay , he must be in his bedroom . My spare glasses are in my bedroom , on my dresser , next to my Bat - signal .
howard_wolowitz I 'm not going in there .
leonard_hofstadter Raj ?
raj_koothrappali No way , Jose .
leonard_hofstadter Well I ca n't do it , I ca n't see anything .
howard_wolowitz It 's all right , wireless mini - cam and Bluetooth headset . We 'll be your eyes .
leonard_hofstadter Fine .

howard_wolowitz One more thing . This is a subsonic impact sensor . If Sheldon gets out of bed and starts to walk , this device will register it and send a signal to the laptop . At that point , based on the geography of the apartment and the ambulatory speed of a sick Sheldon , you 'll have seven seconds to get out , glasses or no glasses .
leonard_hofstadter Wo n't my footsteps set it off ?
howard_wolowitz No , you 'll be on your hands and knees . Now you 'll need to get the sensor as close as you can to Sheldon 's room .
leonard_hofstadter Well , how do I carry it if I 'm on my hands and knees ?
howard_wolowitz Stay low . Bear left . Now keep true .
leonard_hofstadter What ?
howard_wolowitz It means go straight .
leonard_hofstadter Then just say go straight .
howard_wolowitz You do n't stay go straight when you 're giving bearings , you say keep true .
leonard_hofstadter Alright I just hit my head .
howard_wolowitz Because you did n't keep true . Okay , turn right .
raj_koothrappali The ... the picture 's breaking up .

howard_wolowitz Angle your head to the right . A little more . A little more . That 's it , now just keep true . Alright , you 're close enough to Sheldon 's room , deploy the sensor . Now turn it on .
leonard_hofstadter It was n't on ?
howard_wolowitz No .
leonard_hofstadter Then why did I have to crawl ?
howard_wolowitz Oh , I guess you did n't .
leonard_hofstadter Okay , it 's on .
howard_wolowitz Good . From this point forward you will have to crawl .
leonard_hofstadter I know .
howard_wolowitz Hang on , the sensor 's picking up something , turn your head back .

howard_wolowitz Told you the sensor would work .
leonard_hofstadter Hi !
penny You deliberately stuck me with Sheldon .
leonard_hofstadter Well , I had to , you see what he 's like .

leonard_hofstadter No !
penny Here you go , good luck , bye .

sheldon_cooper Leonard , I 'm hungry !
leonard_hofstadter Wait ! Penny ! Take me with you !
sheldon_cooper I want grilled cheese .

leonard_hofstadter I do n't think Penny 's ever coming here again .
